courseDescription:
Explore the Jenkins platform with this online course on DevOps integration that will teach you how to use it to shorten the software development lifecycle while maintaining quality. The course starts by introducing you to the Jenkins platform. Then we discuss the key issues that led to the shift from manual to automated integration. Next, we will explain the Jenkins platform's key architecture and its main features and functions. Finally, we provide a detailed overview of installing the Jenkins platform on your computer and examine the proper configuration settings.

Don't know where to start with the Jenkins platform? The following section dives into creating jobs and pipelines on Jenkins. Video demonstrations ensure that these concepts become crystal clear, from project names to building triggers and executing shell commands. Next, we supply a synopsis of installing the popular tool Artifactory and explain it in detail. Flexibility is critical while creating software. That is where the use of tools is important. Finally, we demonstrate Gradle, an automation tool known for its flexibility in developing software. Creating CI and CD pipelines while using Artifactory and Gradle will be demonstrated.

The next section of the course will look at some tools that can help with DevOps in the DevOps lifecycle management build phase. Another vital tool needed to manage change is Sqitch. We will illustrate the proper use of all these tools with the creation of CI and CD pipelines to ensure that the Jenkins platform functions and features are clearly understood. Another crucial component of the Jenkins server is security. We will analyse the ways to set up security protocols within Jenkins. Finally, we will walk you through how to scale the Jenkins configurations. Managing time is crucial in today's fast-paced and rapidly changing environments. As the world shifts to faster and better technologies, staying up to date with these changes is paramount. So do not waste any more time. Enrol in this online course on Alison.com and understand the Jenkins platform in depth.
